Instead of wasting more taxpayer money on investigations about the 2016 election, it’s time to move on and work together on important legislative issues Americans sent us to Washington to fix. FULL STATEMENT: https://lahood.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-lahood-statement-following-release-special-counsel-robert-mueller-s …

This is a vindication of President Trump on the issue of Russian collusion. Congressional Democrats have long said we need to respect the findings of the Special Counsel and it’s time they put aside their hatred for President Trump and do just that.

I am pleased to see the release of Special Prosecutor Robert Mueller’s report, which confirms what many of us believed and what was outlined in the Attorney General’s memo: there was no collusion between President Trump, his campaign and the Russians.

I had a great visit to Corbion in Peoria this past week. The plant here is a unique facility that scales up the fermentation and processing of healthy algae-based food products. I joined @cathymcmorris, @RepLindaSanchez, and @DorisMatsui to intro our bipartisan CHANGE Act. Alzheimer's touches millions of lives across America and our bill encourages and supports early detection of this disease, high-value patient care, and expanded research initiatives.

The strengthened bond between our two countries must remain if our goal is to achieve lasting stability in the region. I will continue to be an advocate for our vast Lebanese-American community in Illinois' 18th District. pic.twitter.com/wRf1P5nH1T

As the Lebanese gov't continues to stabilize, I underscored the importance of rooting out corruption and thwarting the influence of Iran and Hezbollah within Lebanon. It's critical the US continue to support an independent Lebanese Armed Forces (LAF).

A strong relationship between US + Lebanon is essential to greater stability in the Middle East and I was pleased to see free and fair elections this past year in Lebanon. A peaceful formation of a government has shown Lebanon's commitment to pursuing democracy in the region.

I am proud to be Lebanese-American. My family immigrated to Peoria from Lebanon through Ellis Island. I am grateful to represent 8k+ Lebanese-American families in Peoria. As co-chair of the US-Lebanon Friendship Caucus, I met w/ Lebanese MPs in DC to discuss US-Lebanon relations. pic.twitter.com/Ze4E2ye4ik

Good to meet with EMS responders from Illinois today. We discussed a number of issues including suicide prevention, emergency services in our rural communities, and grant programs that support EMS. Thank you for keeping our communities safe! https://twitter.com/NAEMT_/status/1116009218170073091 …

Voted no on Dems' so-called "Save the Internet" Act. We should be empowering users through the free market system, not putting unelected DC officials in charge of the internet. This bill stifles innovation + weakens access to rural broadband in #IL18 while increasing costs. pic.twitter.com/d0KJ1ljlEo

Not only did we pass my BRIDGE Act, but we also passed important IRS reform today. This bipartisan effort included my bill to empower taxpayers by directing the IRS to provide substantive responses to directives issued by the Taxpayer Advocate. READ ↓ https://bit.ly/2WZpkZ0

BREAKING: My bipartisan bill to fix reemployment services, the BRIDGE for Workers Act, just passed the House by a vote of 393-24.
